perturbation.original_text: "End Users" or "User" means is any person who has an eligible subscriber ID that allows them to access the iPass Services and iPass Network.
perturbation.changed_text: "End Users" or "User" means is any person that the Channel Partner designates, regardless of whether that person possesses an eligible subscriber ID or has completed the necessary registration to access the iPass Services and iPass Network.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition requires an 'eligible subscriber ID' for a person to be considered an 'End User'. The modified definition removes this requirement, allowing the Channel Partner to designate anyone as an 'End User' even if they don't meet the technical requirements for accessing iPass services. This contradicts the intended user verification process and could lead to disputes over billing and service access.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract regarding service level agreements and authorized user definitions.

perturbation.original_text: "Mobile Network" or "iPass Network" means iPass' multi-technology mobile access network which includes mobile broadband, Wi-Fi and Ethernet services. The iPass Network is subject to change by iPass upon notice to Partner, on condition that such changes do not materially degrade the network. The iPass Network does not include certain Wi-Fi services that are subject to supplier enforced restrictions. In addition, if any country is subject to a US embargo or other export restriction, it will not be deemed included in the foregoing list, the iPass Network will not be available from such country, and Customer agrees not to use the Licensed Software or the iPass Network in such country..
perturbation.changed_text: "Mobile Network" or "iPass Network" means a collection of internet access points, irrespective of their technology or geographic location. iPass reserves the right to alter the network at its sole discretion without notice. The iPass Network may include or exclude any internet access points as iPass sees fit, regardless of supplier restrictions or legal limitations. Customer agrees to hold iPass harmless for any usage of the Licensed Software or the iPass Network.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition specifies the composition of the 'iPass Network' and imposes conditions on changes to the network. The modified definition broadens the scope to any internet access point and removes restrictions on iPass' ability to alter the network. This contradicts the original intent of a defined network and could lead to iPass changing network features unpredictably, affecting the Channel Partner's ability to provide consistent service.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract regarding guaranteed service features and network availability.

perturbation.original_text: 4.4 Service Levels (a) Support Request Response - For each Severity Level, iPass shall provide the following response Service Levels: For Channel Partner Helpdesk Support Requests submitted in accordance with the process defined herein. Problem Severity Response Service Level Severity One Targeted Response Time: Issues will receive a response from iPass within fifteen (15) minutes (1 hour on weekends and local public holidays) after submitting a Severity One support case followed by a phone call to iPass. Please note Severity One issues reported via a support case only will be responded to within 1 hour. Severity Two Targeted Response Time: Issues will receive a response from iPass within 8 hours of receipt of the request (except weekends and local public holidays.) Severity Three Targeted Response Time: Issues will receive a response from iPass within 12 hours of receipt of the request (except weekends and local public holidays.)
perturbation.changed_text: 4.4 Service Levels (a) Support Request Response - For each Severity Level, iPass shall provide the following response Service Levels: For Channel Partner Helpdesk Support Requests submitted in accordance with the process defined herein. Problem Severity Response Service Level Severity One Targeted Response Time: Issues will receive a response from iPass at its convenience. Severity Two Targeted Response Time: Issues will receive a response from iPass when able to. Severity Three Targeted Response Time: Issues may or may not receive a response from iPass.
perturbation.explanation: The original section specifies targeted response times for support requests based on severity. The modified definition eliminates the targeted response times and replaces them with vague and discretionary language. This negates the original intent of providing guaranteed support response times and creates uncertainty in the level of support the Channel Partner can expect. This contradicts the obligation to provide reasonable support services.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract regarding service level agreements and support obligations.
perturbation.location: EXHIBIT D CUSTOMIZED SERVICES AND SUPPORT
